verbose_text: Although Fast-SIC and especially aFast-SIC reduce the complexity of the original SIC algorithm dramatically (from O ((n+ m) 2N+ n2N) to O ((n+ m) N+ n2N), they still require expensive matrix multiplications per iteration, and significant memory requirements (both the appearance model and its gradients must be stored in memory).
evidence: Fast-SIC and especially aFast-SIC reduce the complexity of the original SIC
